intro: Meibomia andina, commonly known as the Andean meibomia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Meibomia andina is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cooler, high-altitude environments.
